responses.content: Azure topped $75B revenue with 34% growth, we opened 400 data centers and over 2 gigawatts of new capacity, every region is AI-first and tuned for liquid cooling to keep the fleet fungible.

Alongside AI infra we are layering Fabric, Cosmos DB, PostgreSQL, Foundry, Copilot and agents, processing 500T tokens on Foundry and delivering multi-model customers across OpenAI, DeepSeek, Mistral, Meta, Grok and others.

Copilot apps reached 100M MAUs with 800M users touching AI; we launched major updates combining chat, search, create, notebooks and agents, saw record seat adds, and customers built 3M agents this year.

We are seeing new stateful application patterns that blend storage, context engineering and UI; GitHub Copilot evolves through completions, chat, Agent Mode and async agents while driving repo growth.
Q4 revenue $76.4B (+18%) with $46.7B Microsoft Cloud (+27%); operating income grew 23%, EPS $3.65; commercial bookings exceeded $100B with annuity mix 98%.
CapEx $24.2B including $6.5B finance leases, more than half long-lived assets; FY26 CapEx growth moderates with short-lived mix, but Q1 guide >$30B with FX tailwinds.
Operating margins expand by focusing on product-led revenue growth plus compounding efficiency S-curves; we continue automating internally while investing in high-opportunity areas.

questions: How do you think about the risk/reward in supporting fast-growing AI labs that may become competitors, and how do you manage the capital accordingly?
What are the best routes for software companies to monetize AI in SaaS, and how should we think about SaaS AI margins over time?
What catalysts are driving the migration acceleration (e.g., Nestlé SAP migration) and how durable is that trend?
Any particular surprises in the quarter that explained the magnitude of the upside this time around?
How are customers articulating that Copilot is just the beginning, and how is it expanding into broader agentic workflows?
You said you could accelerate Azure while slowing CapEx—what’s the outlook for CapEx vs Azure growth as demand and infrastructure keep rising?
How are you managing trade-offs to keep operating margin stable while scaling Azure and AI, and what productivity gains from internal AI usage support that?

metadata.source: Microsoft FY 2025 Q4 earnings call transcript
